In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: US announces new sanctions against four judges of the International Criminal Court
subhead: The ICC called these sanctions a 'flagrant attack' on their independence, though the move was praised by Benjamin Netanyahu, who has been under an international arrest warrant since November 2024.

title: US judge denies government request to release Epstein grand jury transcripts
subhead: District Judge Richard Berman noted that the government holds a trove of Epstein investigation materials that it promised in February it would release to the public before abruptly announcing that it would not do so: 'The Government's 100,000 pages of Epstein files and materials dwarf the 70 odd pages of Epstein grand jury materials.'

title: In 'Sentimental Value,' Joachim Trier explores family wounds that never heal
subhead: The Norwegian filmmaker delivers a highly emotional story that won the Grand Prix at Cannes Film Festival.

title: 'A princess of lies': An investigating monk accuses Marthe Robin of 'mystical fraud'
subhead: 'Marthe Robin, Saint or Fraud?' (3/5). In October 2020, Belgian Carmelite Conrad De Meester sent shockwaves through the Catholic world with the publication of a book denouncing the devout French woman as a phony, accusing her of plagiarism and casting doubt on her paralysis.

France faces prospect of paying higher borrowing costs than Italy
subhead: Rome has significantly reduced its public deficit over the past three years, while Paris has allowed its own to spiral. In the eyes of investors, Italy is now as credible as France, despite a heavier debt burden. On the markets, the gap in interest rates between the two countries has nearly vanished.
byline: By Denis Cosnard and Allan Kaval (Rome (Italy) correspondent)

title: The rise and fall of a gang of crypto-ransom kidnappers
subhead: The criminal group behind a string of violent kidnappings in France that recently made headlines started this activity as early as 2023 and was planning further 'attacks.' Its mastermind was arrested on June 3 in Morocco.

title: Diplomatic efforts intensify ahead of possible Zelensky-Putin meeting
